Package seng201.team53.service

Class PathFinderService

java.lang.Object
seng201.team53.service.PathFinderService
public class PathFinderService extends Object
This service finds and validates a path in the map given a matrix

    Description
    int
    calculatePathLength()
    Calculates the path length.
    void
    findPath(Tile[][] tiles, int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
    Finds a path from the starting point (startX, startY) to the ending point (endX, endY) on the map This method uses a depth-first search algorithm to explore possible paths on the map It throws an exception if a path cannot be found or if a path has already been calculated for this map
    javafx.scene.shape.Polyline
    generatePathPolyline()
    Generates a polyline path representing the movement path for carts on the map This method calculates a series of points that define a path that carts will follow.

  • Method Details

    • generatePathPolyline

      public javafx.scene.shape.Polyline generatePathPolyline()
      Generates a polyline path representing the movement path for carts on the map This method calculates a series of points that define a path that carts will follow. The first and last point are offset to allow the path to start and end off-screen
      Returns:
      The generated polyline

    • calculatePathLength

      public int calculatePathLength()
      Calculates the path length. The value 2 is added to the calculation to take into account starting the path off-screen and ending off-screen
      Returns:
      The calculated path length

    • findPath

      public void findPath(Tile[][] tiles, int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Finds a path from the starting point (startX, startY) to the ending point (endX, endY) on the map This method uses a depth-first search algorithm to explore possible paths on the map It throws an exception if a path cannot be found or if a path has already been calculated for this map
      Parameters:
      tiles - The 2D matrix of tiles
      startX - The X coordinate of the start point
      startY - The Y coordinate of the start point
      endX - The X coordinate of the end point
      endY - The Y coordinate of the end point
